clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of Xeloda (Capecitabine) in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer (AXIOM)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of Xeloda in Metastatic Colorectal Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective observational study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of Xeloda (capecitabine) administered in monotherapy in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients will be followed until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity occurs.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Non-Serious Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (up to 42 months)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Number of participants with non-serious AEs was exclusive of serious AEs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Disease Progression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to progressive disease or death (up to 42 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Disease progression was defined as greater than 20 percent (%) increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to progressive disease or death (up to 42 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the period from study entry until disease progression or death from any cause. Disease progression was defined as greater than 20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hand-Foot Syndrome (HFS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (up to 42 months)
secondary_outcome.description: HFS, also called palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia, is a side effect or toxicity associated with specific chemotherapy treatments. The National Cancer Institute (2010) describes it as a condition marked by pain, swelling, numbness, tingling, or redness of the hands or feet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/= 18 years of age
- Metastatic colorectal cancer
- Receiving Xeloda according to registered indication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are not eligible for Xeloda treatment according to the Summary of Product Characteristics
